What’s an Opt-Out request?

An Opt-Out request is a formal instruction from a customer or individual asking to stop receiving marketing communications or certain types of outreach from Reuters. This request ensures compliance with privacy regulations and respects the individual’s communication preferences.

For Reuters, an Opt-Out request typically:

  • Disables marketing emails and newsletters in systems like Sailthru and Eloqua for Marketing.
  • Is submitted through the OneTrust Privacy Portal, where customers can manage their preferences without contacting marketing teams directly.
  • May include opting out of all communications or specific categories (e.g., market research or promotional emails).
  • Once processed, the individual’s profile is updated to prevent future marketing outreach.

What happens if I receive an email2case in Salesforce requesting an Opt-Out?

  • Some customers may use our support email address to request assistance. Please complete the request as a courtesy; you're not required to fill out the form in this case.
  • And email can also be sent by the Internal Staff. If that happens, ensure to complete the request and then educate them to fill out the OneTrust Form
    • Use the email template in Salesforce named "Opt-Out Request." This template will have a note for the staff educating them about the use of the Privacy Form.

What should I do if a DSAR deletion task fails due to active cases linked to the contact in Salesforce?

If you receive a message indicating that a contact cannot be deleted because they are linked to active cases in Salesforce, this means their contact record is still associated with one or more support cases.

Action Required: You must manually remove the contact from all associated cases before proceeding with the deletion. Once the contact has been unlinked from the cases, the deletion can be completed successfully.

⚠️ IMPORTANT

Agents must not send DSAR tasks back or leave them incomplete due to this issue. To remain compliant with the DSAR process, all DSAR tasks must be completed, including manually removing the contact from related cases where necessary.

 

What is a DSAR?

Data Subject Access Request (DSAR) is a request addressed to an organization that gives individuals the right to access information about personal data that might be stored in that organization's records.

Each DSAR will be focused on different request types; we process 2 types:
- Data Access Request: This is when a person wants to know what PI (Personal Information) we have on our records about them. The request requires us to search and gather any information and then send it to the Privacy Team over OneTrust so they can address the customer.
- Delete Request: This request is to delete any PI (Personal Information) we have for an individual. Our responsibility, in this case, is to find the information, delete it and finally advise the Privacy Team on what information was found and deleted for the customer.

 

What to do when the DSAR Request is received by email or on a Salesforce case?

We do not process DSAR requests from the Opt-Out distribution list or on a Salesforce Case. This is because all cases must be documented under the Privacy Team side on the OneTrust Portal.

If you receive a request over email or Salesforce, you are to send an email to the customer redirecting them to fill out the form under the Thomson Reuters Personal Information Request Portal: https://privacyportal.onetrust.com/webform/dbf5ae8a-0a6a-4f4b-b527-7f94d0de6bbc/5dc91c0f-f1b7-4b6e-9d42-76043adaf72d

What's a Prospect?
A prospect is a potential customer who has shown interest in a company's products or services but has not yet made a purchase or commitment. While they are not yet clients and have no contract or subscription, they are valuable as potential future customers.

What's the difference between a Trial and an Auto-Trial?

  • Trial Account: A trial account is a prospect actively engaged by the Sales Team to encourage subscription, typically they're from an organization but can also be an individual (i.e. YouTube streamers). The account is set up with special roles and permissions for product testing, with a standard 30-day duration, extendable based on client and Sales Team management.
  • Auto-Trial Account: An auto-trial account is self-created by an individual, with or without an organization. They can test the product independently, with pre-defined roles and access, for 30 days. Sales Team involvement occurs only if they choose to purchase. These accounts are set up on the Reuters Connect login page by selecting the "Preview Reuters Connect" option (see image below) or at https://www.reutersagency.com/en/reuters-connect/preview-reuters-connect/

Customer-Facing FAQs from the Help Center on Reuters.com:

What is included in a subscription?

A subscription gives you unlimited access to Reuters.com, the definitive destination for global intelligence that powers smart decisions. You will have access to all our award-winning global reporting in every format we offer, as well as in-depth coverage of key sectors and industries. Your subscription will also give you unlimited access to our Reuters News mobile application for news at your fingertips wherever you are.

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Why am I still getting advertising after paying for a subscription?

Currently, Reuters does not offer an ad-free subscription option. However, if you haven’t already, we recommend downloading the Reuters News mobile app, available on both iOS and Android. The app provides an optimized reading experience with fewer ads than the website.

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Can I still access Reuters without a subscription?

Reuters is happy to provide you with free access to a limited number of articles each month. Once you have reached that limit, you will be prompted to subscribe to read an unlimited number of articles on the site. Note that access to certain areas of the site may be subject to additional fees, terms, and conditions.

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

What is your cancellation policy?

Your subscription will renew automatically unless you cancel at least 2 days before the renewal date. You are free to cancel your subscription by informing us at the My account page. Cancellation takes effect at the end of your current subscription period without any refunds. For more information, please visit our Terms and Conditions.

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Do you offer group or corporate subscription programs?

We currently offer enterprise-wide subscriptions and will be launching a more expansive group and corporate subscription program shortly. To reduce the volume of low-value requests that take up a lot of time and are worth very little revenue, we have decided that the minimum number of users for a corporate or group subscription is 50. If the subscription is for a small group, 10 people, for example, they need to use the self-serve route, meaning each person needs to subscribe as an individual.

Please use the following template to answer customers about corporate subscriptions: 

We currently offer enterprise-wide subscriptions and will be launching a more expansive group and corporate subscription program shortly. 

We have decided that the minimum number of users for a corporate or group subscription is 50. If you have a small group, 10 people, for example, you can use the self-serve route, meaning each person needs to subscribe as an individual.

NOTE for Support: If a customer requests to be contacted by Sales to discuss organization/corporate subscriptions, please email Phil Andraos (phil.andraos@thomsonreuters.com) with all relevant information.

The subject line of your email should be "Prospect for Reuters.com Group Subscription." Be sure to include the following details to ensure he can reach the prospect:
- Organization Name
- Organization size: (must be > 50 people)
- Contact Name
- Contact Email
- Contact Phone Number
- Time Zone

IMPORTANT: Phil’s email should NOT be shared externally. Agents must email him directly and never provide his contact information to customers.

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Can I offer a subscription as a gift?

We do not currently offer the option of buying a subscription as a gift, though we are hoping to make this option available in the future.

Is there a separate offering for Thomson Reuters Legal customers?

Thomson Reuters Legal customers may be eligible for a group or corporate subscription. For more information, please contact your Thomson Reuters Legal sales representative.

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Do you accept alternative payment methods?

Unfortunately, alternative payment methods such as PayPal, direct deposit, and electronic wallets are not accepted at this time. We only accept major credit cards (except Discover). As an alternative, you may also use Apple Pay or Google Pay if you subscribe through the Reuters News app on your mobile device.

Customer’s FAQs

Why did I get a notice from PicRights or Copyright Agent?
Normally, this happens when you use one or more images owned or represented by Reuters. Because you’ve infringed Reuter’s copyright you were contacted by our partners so you can resolve the matter of the copyright infringement.

What are PicRights and Copyright Agent?
They are dedicated 3rd party companies dedicated to Copyright enforcement and claims resolution.
Reuters has partnered with PicRights and Copyright Agent to monitor, identify and address unauthorized use of Reuters images on websites worldwide on Reuters’ behalf.

How do PicRights and Copyright Agent work?
PR and CR scan the web to identify sites that might be infringing on our image licenses. Once a site is identified, we conduct a check on the licensing data in our systems. If we have not found a license, PR/ CA will reach out to the site to inquire if it has a license; if no license exists, PR/ CA will try to negotiate a financial settlement with the infringer. We will close the case immediately if the site shows evidence that it has secured a license via Reuters or our distributors.

Where do PicRights and Copyright Agent operate?
PicRights actively operates in the following countries: Austria, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Brazil, Canada, Croatia, Czech Republic, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Serbia, Slovakia, Slovenia, South Africa, Spain, Switzerland, UK, USA.

Copyright Agent is our enforcement partner in the following countries: Australia, Belgium, Chile, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, Latvia, Lithuania, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Poland, and Sweden.

What is a copyright?
Copyright is the exclusive right to reproduce, adapt, use, distribute, and display an original work of authorship, such as a photograph.

Is the problem solved if I remove the image?
No. While removing the image mitigates your liability, it doesn’t solve the problem. The use of copyrighted images requires proper licensing to cover all uses. Therefore, payment of a license fee is required to resolve the matter completely.

What if we are a non-profit organization and/or charity?
A non-profit organization or charity must follow copyright laws like everyone else. There’s no exemption for non-profits under the Copyright Act.

Are there any special cases?
On occasions, someone in Reuters may have shared photos outside of the normal licensing process—e.g., if we gained access to an event or location through an informal arrangement that allowed the subject to use our photos. If you know of any such arrangements, please identify them to ReutersCopyright@thomsonreuters.com, and we can whitelist those URLs so that PicRights or Copyright Agent will not scan them.

What is NSFW?
NSFW is the abbreviation for "not safe for work" or "not suitable for work," and it is used to warn someone that something (content, comments, a website, email attachment, etc.) is not suitable for viewing at most places of employment.

This content normally contains crude and descriptive content that may affect people deeply. These kinds of comments, even when they may seem relevant or be similar to feedback, are not safe to share within the organization and must not be shared.

What is SPAM?
SPAM refers to unsolicited messages, usually commercial messages (such as emails, text messages, or Internet postings) sent to a large number of recipients or posted in a large number of places. They may be repetitive, irrelevant notes or comments about random topics.

column1:
1. For all queries, search for the accurate point of contact using the resources below: 

 

a. Using Workspace: 

Workspace - News Monitor - Run searches using product names, RICs, PNACs, etc. 

 

 

b. RNS POC Sheet: 

Cross check ‘Reporters Per Query’ section under Bangalore to figure POC of journalists to whom we send out regular set of queries to. 

Keep the RNS POC sheet updated with new contacts as and how they come through. 

Utilise the notes column to explain the contact/leave any important updates when needed. 

 

c. Non-update queries: 

Check Workspace and RNS POC sheet first. 

If no leads are available, follow the screenshot provided, send it to the journalist(s) mentioned there and tag their manager for a faster response. 

For all Non-update queries, continue tagging the concerned POC within the same chain. We needn’t create a separate chain for the same (for example: US RTR, EU RTR, US/UK Products or market reports, Kazakhstan Netbacks, WLD RTR 1/2 PRODUCTS, etc.) 

The above point is not inclusive of queries related to CBOT/FUNDS, KARACHI COTTON PRICES, PALM OIL, MILLFEEDS, BANGKOK WEEKLY RICE, etc. please be mindful of the same as these reporters have previously mentioned for Refinitiv to not reach out to them directly. 

For queries where there are no responses for long, kindly give it a 5-day gap before seeking out the next update (this applies to non-update queries only). 

Add the managers of the reporters from the first go to receive faster resolutions on the queries. 

Once the reporter sends out the update, follow up with the below response saying: 

 

Thank you for the update XXX. 

Hi LSEG Team, 

Please find the below response, we are closing this mail chain from our end. 

2. When no leads are available, please make it a point to acknowledge the query first and then reach out to Sanjana/Akshay over the team’s channel. 

3. Whenever there are escalations regarding updates/feedbacks/comments concerning our team or other queries, check with Sanjana first and then send across the response. 

4. How many apologies are too many apologies? 

In cases where we do not receive updates for a long period of time (e.g.: Karachi Cotton Prices from Ariba), follow up after a period of 5 consistent days of no replies and directly escalate it to Jonathan. 

5. For escalation queries, always tag/mention both Jonathan Leff and Richard Baum, whoever responds first, we will take that response forward accordingly. 

6. When we have to re-direct queries from LSEG, please use the below boiler plate: 

Under the new support structure agreed between Reuters News and Refinitiv, folks from the newsroom will not be able to respond to your query directly.  Please re-direct any responses to @refinitivnewssupport and we will get in touch with the concerned team. 

Then forward the query to the reporter and continue per protocol. 

7. In the tracker, explain the query in a line or two and avoid copying the subject line for explanation purposes. 

8. When there are queries related to wrong topic codes/missing news/wrong RIC, etc., please make sure to get in touch with the reporters first and then the metadata team as not all queries in this area pertain to the metadata team. Some of these corrections can be made by the reporters themselves. Please do keep in mind that this changes from query to query, hence kindly research the nature of the query first and then send it across to the metadata team. 

9. When we receive queries on the use of any data/news for redistribution or any questions around licensing/restrictions it needs to be sent to Jonathan Leff and Carol Fox, who handle the commercial relationship between LSEG and Thomson Reuters. An example of this query is attached above.  

10. Going forward, when we send out responses to teams within Reuters and spot additional DL’s that need to be removed in the ‘To’ section (especially in non-update queries), kindly move them to BCC and mention the below in the body of your e-mail: 

Moving XXX to BCC. 

11. For non-update cases, where trade dates for products such as COT PK or LIV/H, etc., are in question, do not treat a new trade date request as a new RNS case if a new trade date update on the same/existing mail chain is sought after by LSEG. The case remains the initial owners itself. Please take it forward as required and avoid categorising a single case in more than one category unless spoken to/required otherwise. In the tracker you'll have to mention under the description that the query is for two trade dates accordingly. 

12. For non-update queries like COT/PK, LIV/H, WHE/HRW, MILLFEED, GRA/PM please check for updated data on eikon every six hours and convey the same to LSEG. (This is because the data is updated a few hours after the query comes through and the response for the same is conveyed almost a day later). 

13. Kindly add Liz Hampton for Non-update of US products | US RTR SPOT CRUDE DIFF | US RTR LPG Market compulsorily. 

14. For MILLFEED, should LSEG seek an update before 6PM Central time kindly convey this boilerplate - Please be aware that the reports will be published by 6 PM central.
